text:
Ro: Hello, it's Ro!  Welcome to Nerdy Nummies! I have
a special guest today, I have
Ro: H to the USKY, Husky!

Husky: Perfect, I drove all the way from my
bedroom down, around the corner.

Ro: Yes, we are roommates, and he was nice
enough to come help me today.

Ro: We are going to be making Star Wars magic
today. We are going to be making
Ro: Star Wars Cookies, and, Lightsabers!

Husky: The tools we are gonna need today are
super, super simple, we have our

Husky: awesome Millennium Falcon cookie cutter
right there, and not to scale,

Husky: but I believe this is Darth Vader’s
Tie Fighter we have going on.

Ro: Yes! Husky: So that’s gonna be our 2
to start with.

Husky: We also, of course, have the good old
mustache-ula.

Ro: We also have a big rolling pin, cookie
tray, and a big mixing bowl.

Ro: The ingredients that we will be using
today, will be: Sugar cookie mix,

Ro: flour, Husky: 1 stick of Tillamook butter,
and a single egg from any

Husky: state that you want your eggs from.
Ro: Yes, let’s get started!
Husky: First we’re going to add this delicious cooke mix.

Ro: Yes, sugar cooke mix! Husky: Oh! It also
says on the back, do not eat
Husky: raw cookie dough. Ha-ha… Yeah right.
Husky: OK… Ro: Everyone eats the cookie dough.

Husky: Everyone, it’s like the rules. Ro:
I don’t know anyone who doesn’t.

Husky: And now that I’m an adult, I realized
that my parents can’t stop me.

Ro: We’re gonna add 1 stick of Tillamook
butter, now your 1 egg…

Husky: Don’t mess up. Ro: Don’t drop the
shell! Husky: Ah. Ro: Nice!

Husky: Much easier with just 1 egg. Ro: I used my
Jedi powers for that 1.

Ro: Wasn’t expecting that to go so well.
So now,this is where you’re

Ro: gonna get your hands dirty. You’re gonna
just work everything together,
Ro: and I’m gonna need you to grab the flour.

Husky: Yeah, I’ll let you do that part,
that seems like the really fun part…

Ro: So I’m get starting… Get started on
this, and then in a little bit
Ro: I’m gonna ask you to add some flour.

Husky: Alright, I’m ready, I’m manning
the King Arthur Flour.
Ro: Because… King Arthur, it’s my favorite!

Husky: I feel like I should have worn that
guy’s outfit. Ro: Yeah, you should have.

Husky: And rode in on a black horse, that
would have been awesome!

Ro: Yeah, thanks for not doing that. Husky:
I know, it wasn’t in the budget.

Ro: Wow… Husky: It’s kind of hard to own
a horse in LA, I have a feeling.

Ro: This is getting, so it’s really, really
sticky, and the instructions on the

Ro: back of cookie mixes say that, if you
want to just do the regular sugar

Ro: cookies, you just throw these on the sheet,
but if you want to make cuts,

Ro: then you’re supposed to add a teaspoon
of flour. No, no, no, don’t listen

Ro: to those instructions, you need to use
a lot of flour.
Husky: So you want a Husky load of flour? Ro: Yes, H to the USKY Husky, will you please  give me some flour!

Ro: Just start shake, shake, shake, more,
more, more, more, more, more, more…

Ro: More, more, maybe you should look where
your flour’s going.

Husky: No, I’m, eye contact with the audience
at all times. Ro: Wow, wow!
Ro: Um, pfft, pfft!

Ro: You’re not gonna commentate my dough…
Husky: I should commentate it.

Husky: I don’t know if you guy can see it,
but, this is great!

Husky: We have a nice consistency of it there,
the timing of it was perfect,

Husky: it’s just, the real question is when
is she gonna move out to the

Husky: cookie sheet, expand to the natural,
set up a forward base, and
Husky: warp in reinforcements.

Ro: Once the dough can stick to itself and
it won’t stick to your hands anymore,

Ro: then it’s time to roll it out and start…
Start cutting out your shapes.

Husky: Oh it looks so good! Ro: OK, Huskies,
grab the flour and sprinkle it…
Husky: This is a rolling pin, haha!

Ro: You want to coat your mat with flour so
that the dough doesn’t stick,
Ro: and now we shall roll out the dough!

Husky: I would just like to say that this
would be a delicious cookie.

Ro: But its… Husky: It’s a Death Star
Cookie, Rosanna! Look.
Husky: This cookie is now fully operational.

Ro: Now you take your rolling pin, and you
coat it with a little bit of flour.
Ro: Can you sprinkle some flour on here?

Ro: Sprinkle, sprinkle, sprinkle! Yes! And
you just work it all the way around…

Ro: Like that. Husky: Can you show me that
again?

Ro: Wow, I think we’re done, I think we’re
done. Husky: I, I'm just…
Ro: Now you roll out the dough.

Husky: We already know what the comments were
gonna be.

Ro: Now we are gonna sprinkle a little bit
of flour on top,

Ro: and start cutting these out. And I like
to give it a little jiggle.
Husky: Jiggle, jiggle, jiggle, jiggle!
Ro: Jiggle, jiggle, jiggle, jiggle!

Ro: And then you start, once they’re cut
out, I’ll let you finish your last cutout.

Husky: This 1 has to be perfect. Ro: Oh, OK,
I’ll stand back.
Husky: Ah, there we go!
Ro: Fa-da!

Ro: OK, now you just peel off all the excess.
OK now pick these little guys up and
Ro: stick them on the baking tray.

Husky: I’ve been thinking about it, because
I love this dough, I think I figured

Husky: it out. Our parents tell us not to
eat this, because they eat it!

Ro: It’s not because it has a raw egg in
it…

Husky: And then the leftover, you make into
a 3D Deathstar.

Ro: Yes let’s make a Deathstar ball, let’s
do it! Here, here!
Husky: Surely this, nothing can go wrong!

Ro: What is that? Husky: It’s my Deatstar
Rosanna!
Husky: It’s like a ball with a hole in it!

Ro: Now it’s time to bake. We’re gonna
bake these cookies for about 9 minutes,
Ro: and you want to heat your oven to 350.

Ro: While we are waiting for the cookies to
bake, we melted red and green…

Ro: Those are hot, those are hot! Husky: Yeah
don’t drink those.

Ro: It’s red and green melted chocolate.
And we’re gonna dip large pretzel sticks

Ro: into them. Husky: Yes! Ro: Do you want
to do red lightsaber, or…

Husky: I’ll, I’ll do green. Ro: Green
lightsaber? Husky: I’ll do green, green’s

Husky: a good color. Ro: OK, I think the Dark
Side uses red, are you ready?

Husky: Oh these are hot! Yeah, alright, ready,
set, dip! Ro: Dip!

Husky: Got some carbonite dipping going on.
Ro: And you have to kind of tip it,

Ro: just a little bit. Husky: Yeah. Ro: And
twirl, twirl, twirl.

Ro: And then you’re gonna pull them up,
and let them drip for just a second.

Ro: But these are awesome, they’re gonna
look like just little Lightsabers!

Ro: Did you let it drip? Husky: You know,
I mean…
Ro: That’s a no, he didn’t, he didn't listen to me.

Husky: Perfect! Ro: Boom! OK. Husky: Looks,
just outstanding.

Ro: Then put them on the wax paper for them
to dry.

Husky: Ahhhh, still hot! Ro: Don’t grab
it there!
Husky: Deathstar’s ready!

Ro: I’m really nervous, it’s probably
gonna be burnt.

Husky: What? It’s a big ball of dough! I,
nothing could go wrong…

Ro: Ta-da! Our cookies are done! Here’s
all our little ships!

Husky: They look so amazing! And, our Deathstar
came out, I would say

Husky: better than expected. Here he is! Ta-da…
This just looks perverted,

Husky: I don’t even know what this is. But,
uh…

Ro: It’s not even like, fully cooked. Well…
Husky: He’s kinda, he’s kinda there.

Ro: Actually, it’s cooked on the bottom.
Husky: The bottom looks, the bottom looks

Husky: pretty delicious, so… Ro: You could
probably eat the bottom of it.

Husky: Ah, no we gotta wait. Ro: Are you gonna
actually decorate it?

Husky: Uh yeah, I don’t see why not, actually
this looks more like a belly button.

Husky: Let’s start frosting them. I am really
excited for this.

Ro: Yes! OK, first you take your mustache-ulas,
and we’ve dyed this frosting gray.

Ro: And we’re just gonna spread the gray frosting
all over our cookie so pick a cookie.
Husky: Alright, I’ll use my Millennium Falcon.

Ro: OK, I'll do, I’ll do a Millennium Falcon
too!

Ro: That’s really good! Husky: This is some
top notch cake decorating

Husky: we got going on right now. Ro: I’m
actually shocked. I’m, I’m impressed.

Husky: Ain’t no thing, my APM, my APM of
frosting is pretty high!

Husky: Well while you finish up those and make
those look good, I am going to

Husky: decorate, I know we already said this
but it looks so much like a

Husky: belly button, but it is a Deathstar
guys, come on, stay focused.

Ro: It’s really in space, space is really
dark, so how you really know what

Ro: color anything is, there’s no lights
out there. Husky: That’s true.

Husky: Except for suns I guess, maybe. Ro:
Stars, I didn’t say that, let’s
Ro: take that back, retract, retract!
Husky: Surely they’ll get rid of it in editing.
TF2: Nope!

Ro: Perfect! That looks just like Darth Vader’s
Deathstar, doesn’t it guys?

Husky: This is gonna be all over reddit! Look
at what Husky made!

Ro: Where’s the hole? Oh maybe it’s like
a security thing so you can’t

Ro: find the weakness. Husky: Yeah. Yeah my
Deathstar is not vulnerable.

Ro: We’re almost done with these, so we’re
gonna put them in the

Ro: fridge for about 10 minutes to smooth
out. And then we will be right back.

Ro: Pulled the cookies out of the fridge and
now it is time to decorate with

Ro: frosting. We have white and black-ish
gray, waaaaaahhh!
Ro: Now we get to work!
Ro: Ba-da!

Ro: All of our Star Wars magic is all done,
and um…

Husky: Mine came out absolutely amazing! Ro:
Husky’s is over here.

Ro: This is his death star. Husky: Mmmhmmm.
Ro: His Millennium Falcon.

Husky: Which looks like a piranha fish! Ro:
It looks like a fish!

Ro: And his tie fighter. Husky: But, well
we’re recreating the scene of the end

Husky: of the movie, where they’re fighting
to destroy the Deathstar.

Ro: Pew-pew! Pew-pew! Husky: Only my Deathstar
isn’t nearly as intimidating as
Husky: something that can blow up a planet.

Ro: It looks pretty scary, don’t underestimate
it!

Husky: But over here at exhibit B is the actual
ones that look amazing.

Ro: Lightsaber battle! Husky: Pshhhhhhh!!!
Oh-ho-ho-no!

Ro: Thank you H to the USKY, Husky for coming
and being a guest today on
Ro: Nerdy Nummies!

Ro: If you have any ideas, please leave me
a comment for any future Nerdy Nummies!
Ro: Thanks for watching! Bye-bye!

Husky: These are not the cookies you’re
looking for!
